subject: Education
title: The Testing Effect: Quizzing Beats Reviewing
description: A quick, practical guide to The Testing Effect: Quizzing Beats Reviewing.

hook.text: Students who took a practice quiz remembered 50% more a week later than those who re-studied.

buildup.text: Most learners avoid testing themselves because it feels uncomfortable and exposing.

discovery.text: Retrieving information from memory strengthens the neural pathways to that knowledge.

twist.text: Even getting the wrong answer on a quiz improves later memoryâ€”the struggle itself helps.

climax.text: Low-stakes quizzing is now considered one of the most powerful learning tools available.

punchline.text: Every quiz is a workout for your memory muscles.

quiz.question: Why does self-testing improve memory more than re-studying?
options: Retrieving information strengthens the neural pathways to that knowledge
Tests cause stress, which permanently encodes information
Re-studying overwrites old memories with new ones
